title: Everybody’s Mad at Twitch - Kinda Funny Games Daily 09.21.22
description:
Go to http://meundies.com/KINDAFUNNY for 20% off your first order and free shipping.

Go to http://shopify.com/kfgames to get a free 14-day trial.

Twitch has banned gambling! Yay... wait they're doing WHAT to streamer revenue?? Blessing is joined by special guest Jennifer Locke to talk about why everybody is mad at Twitch, Logitech's new handheld, and even more leaks!

Follow Jen: https://twitter.com/JenLocke95

Time Stamps:
00:00:00 - Start
00:08:04 - Housekeeping
Do you like Bless Who, Kinda Funny Gamescast’s Trivia Post Show? Well the poll is back open for the fan favorite game Kinda Feudy! Go over on Blessing’s twitter, find the tweet and fill out the prompts to help shape the answers on the show.
https://twitter.com/BlessingJr/status/1571925122344452097
PS I Love You XOXO is recording today and it’s our God of War (2018) re-review! Go over to Patreon.com/KindaFunnyGames to get your write-ins read on the show. Then that episode will go up for everyone on Thursday.
There’s a new Kinda Funny Xcast up right now on Youtube.com/KindaFunnyGames and on podcast services around the globe.
Thank you to our Patreon Producer:
FargoBrady
Today, we’re brought to you by Shopify and MeUndies but we’ll tell you about that later.
The Roper Report   -
00:10:20 - Twitch Cracks Down on Gambling Streams After Recent Controversies - Ryan Leston @ IGN
00:13:55 - Twitch is cutting how much its biggest streamers earn from subs - Jay Peters @ The Verge
00:30:22 - Logitech has officially revealed their gaming handheld - Tom Warren @ The Verge
00:38:25 - 2K has been hacked - Jordan Middler @ VGC
00:42:25 - Another one of those games in the NVIDIA Leak has been confirmed - Andy Robinson @ VGC
00:46:23 - Sony XDev is working with Team Ninja on Rise of the Ronin - Tom Ivan @ VGC
00:52:04 - Ted Lasso and AFC Richmond Officially Announced for FIFA 23 - Ryan Leston @ IGN
00:54:55 - Out today
00:56:08 - You‘re Wrong
Tomorrow’s Hosts:Blessing and Funke Joseph (formerly Fanbyte)

Epic Creator Code: KindaFunny

number three Logitech has officially revealed their gaming handheld this comes from Tom Warren at The Verge Logitech is officially announcing its gcloud gaming handheld today after a teaser and a leak last month the Android powered 349.99 handheld will arrive on October 17th with access to the Google Play Store Xbox cloud gaming and nvidia's GeForce now service while you'll be able to play Android mobile games the focus is really on cloud gaming and the handheld has been engineered this way to provide 12 hours or more of battery life the cloud gaming handheld has a 7-inch 1080p IPS touchscreen with a 16x9 aspect ratio and 60hz refresh rate the white handheld includes two offset analog thumbsticks a d-pad and yba and X buttons there's also four more buttons at the front lash Tech G home menu and a context menu button inside Logitech is using a Qualcomm Snapdragon 720g G processor which is an octa-core CPU that runs up to 2.3 gigahertz Logitech has also provided a Micro SD card for

menu and a context menu button inside Logitech is using a Qualcomm Snapdragon 720g G processor which is an octa-core CPU that runs up to 2.3 gigahertz Logitech has also provided a Micro SD card for expansion but there's no 5G or SIM card support here so you'll always need to be near Wi-Fi for cloud games Logitech has worked with Microsoft and Nvidia to integrate Xbox cloud gaming and nvidia's GeForce now service into the handheld Logitech has also parted with 10 cent on this handheld and has leaned on the Chinese company's expertise and software to help design the Android Launcher Logitech appears to be testing the waters by limiting the launch of the g-cloud gaming handheld to the US in Canada in October to entice early adopters there's a limited 299.99 pre-order offer ahead of the retail price of 300 349.99 this pricing is Right Between the Nintendo switch at 300 and the steam deck at 400 so it could be a tough sell for what's mostly a cloud gaming device Jen have you been keeping
